title: Livestock Integration at the Dakota Lakes Research Farm - Cody Zilverberg

tasks.task: Present ideas on integrating livestock with crops for biological and economic diversity.
subtasks: Explain reasons for integrating livestock, such as economic diversity and soil benefits.
Discuss advantages of perennials in crop rotations, including deep roots and soil nutrient cycling.
Describe Dakota Lakes' 15-year crop rotation followed by 5 years of perennials, highlighting switchgrass establishment challenges.
Present results from switchgrass and Big Bluestem trials, comparing their productivity and quality.
Detail methods for transitioning pastures to natives, including spraying, seeding, and rotational grazing.
Compare nutrient retention between cattle on feedlots versus pastures, emphasizing the value of on-farm nutrient cycling.
Highlight the potential of precision feeding systems (e.g., electronic ID feeders) for tailored livestock nutrition.
Explain the challenges and benefits of regenerative grazing practices, including manure distribution and soil health.
Address the economic and environmental trade-offs of cover cropping, including fertilizer impact and yield comparisons.
